intro: Drepananthus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy dwarf lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
